DataElement.preferredName: Patient History Investigational Treatment Regimen Interference Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether patient's history may interfere with the investigational regimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Personal Medical History Investigational Treatment Regimen Interference
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._In the process of being studied; experimental._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Personal Medical History Investigational Treatment Regimen Interference
Property.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._In the process of being studied; experimental._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
In the process of being studied; experimental.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.
The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has a prior or concurrent malignancy, does their natural history or treatment have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment has the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen are eligible for this trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has a prior or concurrent malignancy, does their natural history or treatment have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the imaging intervention?
